  \cellcolor{green!5}\small \@Martin G√•rd Alot of white nationalist tend to claim that the IQ gap between \textbf{black} people and white people has a indisputably large genetic basis, but that's largely nonsense. Adoption studies are the most effective method for attempting to quantify just¬†how much¬†of the \textbf{black}-white IQ gap is genetic versus environmental. By ensuring that blacks \& whites are reared in the same environment, one can conclude any differences that arise are genetic. Inversely, by ensuring that two groups of blacks are genetically similar, we can conclude that any differences that arise are environmental. There are four major transracial adoption studies that I know of. I will consider each.Study 1: Minnesota Transracial Adoption StudyI'm sure many of you have heard of this study, so I need not give it too much detail. Basically, the study examined the IQ test scores of adopted children of different races \& of non-adopted white children, all of whom were raised by white families. The study found higher IQ for the whites adoptees compared to the \textbf{black} adoptees¬†[1]. If this study did indeed equalize the environments for blacks \& whites, then the results would seem to indicate that the IQ gap is largely genetic. However, there are two reasons to doubt that the study equalized the environments for blacks \& whites:(1) the children with two \textbf{black} parents were adopted substantially later than the other children. The average white child was adopted at about 19 months \textbf{old}, but the average child with two \textbf{black} parents was adopted at 32 months \textbf{old}. The results of the study showed that children who were adopted later had much lower IQs than those who were adopted earlier. \textbf{Black} children adopted within one year of birth had IQs 7 points higher than those adopted later, for example.(2), while the study did somewhat equalize environments¬†after¬†adoption, they failed to equalize environments¬†before¬†adoption. This can be extremely important as well. For example, a high blood lead level in infants can result in a noticeable reduction in IQ during adulthood. Blood lead level is particularly important for the blacks in this study because when this study was published in the 1970s, the blood lead level of \textbf{black} children aged 6 months-5 years was¬†extremely¬†higher than the level for white children of the same \textbf{age}. Thus, lead could have played a significant role in the \textbf{black} children's IQ. Blood lead level is just one example. Factors such as social stimulation before adoption are also important to a child's cognitive development, but the study could not have equalize such factors.Study 2 German IQ study by Klaus EyferthThis was a study conducted by psychologist Klaus Eyferth concerning the IQs of white and racially mixed children in West Germany. The mothers of the children studied were white German women, while their fathers were white or \textbf{black} members of the US occupation forces. The white children recorded an average IQ of 97.2, whereas the mixed children recorded an average of 96.5, a negligible difference¬†.Some have discounted this data by asserting that the samples aren't representative of the average population because about 30 of \textbf{black} applicants were rejected and not admitted to the armed forces, while only about 3 of whites were rejected. It is true that the samples are not representative, but that doesn't discount the results of the study. Despite the unrepresentative sample, if IQ were genetic, then we would still expect the white children to have much higher scores that the \textbf{black} children because:The white GIs should have had higher scores than the \textbf{black} GIs. It is true that both the white soldiers and the \textbf{black} soldiers in this study had IQs above a certain threshold; however, the IQ scores for the white soldiers would be distributed higher than the blacks, leading to a higher average score. If the IQ gap were genetic, then we would expect this difference to be found in their children as well.(3) Regression to the mean. Even if the white soldiers and \textbf{black} soldiers had similar IQ scores, then, if the IQ gap were genetic, we would still expect the \textbf{black} children to have lower IQs than the white children. The reason is because the \textbf{black} kids' IQs would regress downward to the \textbf{black} mean of 85, while the whites kids' IQs would regress to the white mean of 100. Of course the gap between the white \& \textbf{black} kids would be smaller because both groups would have white mothers, but the gap would be larger than 0.7 points.The lack of an IQ difference in this study means that the results are not compatible with genetics being the biggest cause of the IQ gap. Like the Minnesota study, the study is flawed in its own way. Nevertheless, it is compatible with a 100 environmental explanation.Study 3¬†British study of young children in nurseriesIn this study, psychologist Barbara Tizard studied \textbf{black}, white, and mixed-race children raised in British long-stay residential nurseries. The children were given psychological tests to determine their cognitive abilities. The scores were converted to give a mean of 100, and a standard deviation of 10. On one test, the white children scored 102.6 and the \textbf{black}/mixed children scored 106.3. On another test, the white children scored 98.5 and the \textbf{black}/mixed children scored 98.6. On the Minnesota Nonverbal test, the white children scored 101.3 and the \textbf{black}/mixed children scored 107.7. Apparently there is a fourth test, but I didn't manage to see it in the pdf. In any case, this study clearly does not support the genetic theory. This study is compatible with a 100 environmental explanation of the IQ gap.Study 4: IQ scores of \textbf{black} children raised by white families versus \textbf{Black} familiesIn this study, psychologist Elsie Moore compared IQ test scores among 23 \textbf{black} children adopted by middle-class white families and 23 \textbf{age}-matched \textbf{black} children adopted by middle-class \textbf{black} families. Their findings indicate that the \textbf{black} children adopted by \textbf{black} families scored a 104 IQ, while the \textbf{black} children adopted by white families scored a 117 IQ. Clearly, these two groups of blacks differed in their¬†environment¬†and not their¬†genes.¬†Therefore, the difference in the \textbf{black}/white family environments must account for the 13 IQ points. Keep in mind that the \textbf{black} \& white families were of similar socioeconomic status (middle-class). In actuality, the average \textbf{black} family has a much lower socioeconomic status than the average white family, therefore the difference in \textbf{black}/white environments would account for more than 13 points, accounting for essentially the entire IQ gap. Clearly, this study is compatible with a 100 environmental explanation of the IQ gap.Many have criticized the three latter studies because they did not do follow-up testing on the children. It is true that the genetic component of IQ increases as children \textbf{age}. However, this decline is not necessarily relevant. We are concerned with the¬†gap¬†between blacks \& whites. The Minnesota Transracial Study implies that there is no significant change in the¬†gap¬†after \textbf{age} 7. Looking at this study, the \textbf{black}-white IQ gap fluctuated by only about 2 points after \textbf{age} 7.   \cellcolor{green!5}\small In biology, a species is the basic unit of classification and a taxonomic rank, as well as a unit of biodiversity, but it has proven difficult to find a satisfactory definition. Scientists and conservationists need a species definition which allows them to work, regardless of the theoretical difficulties. If as Linnaeus thought, species were fixed, there would be no problem, but evolutionary processes cause species to change continually, and to grade into one another. A species is often defined as the largest group of organisms in which two individuals can produce fertile offspring, typically by \textbf{sexual} reproduction. While this definition is often adequate, when looked at more closely it is problematic. For example, with hybridisation, in a species complex of hundreds of similar microspecies, or in a ring species, the boundaries between closely related species become unclear. Among organisms that reproduce only asexually, the concept of a reproductive species breaks down, and each clone is potentially a microspecies. Problems also arise when dealing with fossils, since reproduction cannot be examined; the concept of the chronospecies is therefore used in palaeontology. Other ways of defining species include their karyotype, DNA sequence, morphology, behaviour or ecological niche.\normalsize   & \cellcolor{green!5}Sexual & \cellcolor{green!5}Gender - General & \cellcolor{green!5}1/195 & \cellcolor{green!5}0.513 \\  \hline

And in whites, the palate is parabolic with the ends of the ‚ÄòU' flaring outwards. The transverse palatine suture that horizontally transects the palate also varies by \textbf{race}: It is straight in American Indians, curved in blacks, and a jagged line in whites.The nose: The nose provides multiple \textbf{race} indicators. White, \textbf{Black}, American Indians and Asian skulls have key features that are easily distinguishable from one another. Forensic investigators use these features all the time to determine the \textbf{race} of a victim when all they find is a skull. Here are some of the features Forensic Investigators use to determine the \textbf{race} of a person from a skull:The palate and palatine suture:¬† The hard palate is the \textbf{bony} structure at the top of the mouth bordered by the upper teeth. In American Indians, the palate is elliptical, with the ‚ÄòU' shape angling in at the back teeth. In blacks, the palate is hyperbolic‚Äîa perfect ‚ÄòU' shape with straight lines. And in whites, the palate is parabolic with the ends of the ‚ÄòU' flaring outwards. In blacks, the nasal aperture is short and wide with a low bridge and a guttered or trough-like nasal sill. In American Indians, the nasal aperture is medium-sized with both a medium bridge and nasal sill.Teeth: Whites tend to have smaller teeth, often with significant crowding. Blacks rarely have crowding and the upper teeth often project outwards due to the angled shape of the maxilla. American Indians have well spaced teeth but often exhibit sclerosed dentition‚Äîwhen calcium deposits build up inside the tooth, thinning the root canal‚Äîleaving teeth loose within the mandible and easily cracked.The shape of the incisors is also an important indicator of \textbf{race} in the teeth. In American Indians (and East Asians, both of \textbf{Mongoloid} ancestry), the incisors are shovel-shaped, named because the inner surface is scooped or curved. \textbf{Black} and whites both have blade-form incisors where the tooth has a flat profile.The mastoid process: The shape of the mastoid process differs between the races.   \cellcolor{green!27}\small from redice [LINK] Dnews begins their video by claiming that there is no biological basis for racial classification. Instead, according to Dnews, \textbf{race} is a cultural construct. This claim is strongly contradicted by the relevant scientific facts. Consider, for example, (Rosenberg et al. 2002) which found that researchers could correctly predict someone's \textbf{race} by looking at their genome nearly 100 of the time. In fact, (Tang et al. 2005) showed that even when looking at people from the United States, a country with a long history of \textbf{race} mixing, researchers can still correctly identify someones \textbf{race} based on genetic analysis alone 98.7 of the time. Furthermore, as demonstrated by (Witherspoon et al. 2007), members of the same \textbf{race} are almost always more genetically similar than members of different races. And the biology of \textbf{race} is not limited to genes. For instance, as noted in (Sesardic 2010), researchers have been able to correctly identify someone's \textbf{race} by analyzing their skeletons for decades.Dnews also attempts to cast doubt on the idea that there are significant genetic differences between people by noting that all humans share 99.9 of their genetic code with one another. In other words, humans, on average, are genetically identical except for 1 in 1,000 base pairs. This is true, but Dnew's interpretation of this statistic is misleading. According to Dnew's own source, there are around 3 billion base pairs in the human genome and so differing at a rate of 1 per 1,000 base pairs means that humans, on average, differ by 3 million base pairs. To put this in perspective, a difference of a single base pair can cause significant differences between people. For instance, the genetic disease sickle cell anemia is caused by a mutation in a single base pair. Consider further that (Polderman et al. 2015) combined decades worth of data on 14.5 million twins and found that, on average, about half of the differences between people were caused by genetic differences between them. (Bouchard 2004) found similar estimates when examining the behavioral genetic literature on psychological differences between people. Clearly then, there are genetic differences between people and they have very significant effects.\normalsize   & \cellcolor{green!27}Race & \cellcolor{green!27}Ethnicity - General & \cellcolor{green!27}7/359 & \cellcolor{green!27}1.95 \\  \hline

  \cellcolor{green!27}\small The NIBSIDI SCRIPT (4500 B.C. - present) Nsibidi is an ancient script used to write various languages in West Central Africa. Most notably used by the Uguakima and Ejagham (Ekoi) people of Nigeria and Cameroon, nsibidi is also used by the nearby Ebe, Efik, Ibibio, Igbo and Uyanga people. The nsibidi set of symbols is an independent writing system and is believed by some scholars to date back to 5000 B.C., but the most decisive archaeological evidence ever found (monoliths in Ikom, Nigeria) dates it to 2000 B.C. Very similar to the Kemetic medu neter (called Egyptian hieroglyphics by the Greeks) nsibidi is a system of standardized pictographs. In fact, both nsibidi and the Kemetic medu neter share several of the exact characters. Nsibidi was divided into sacred and public versions, however, Westernization drastically reduced the number of nsibidi-literate people, leaving a sacred version as the last surviving form of the symbols.   \cellcolor{green!5}\small The idea that \textbf{race} has \textbf{nothing} to do with biology is not tenable. A competent researcher can look at someone's genome, or skeleton, and predict their \textbf{race} with a high degree of accuracy. The fact that everyone's genome is 99.9 the same doesn't change the fact that there are large differences. That .1 amounts to, on average, 3 million base pair differences between a pair of individuals. A difference of a single base pair can cause a significant difference. For instance, the genetic disease sickle cell anemia is caused by a mutation in a single base pair.¬†The video mentions subspecies but fails to tell the audience that human races are more genetically distant from each-other than many subspecies among other animals are. I think that is a pretty important fact to bring up when discussing the reality of \textbf{race}.¬†The discussion of \textbf{race} differences in disease rate is also lacking because it ignores the fact that some of these differences have clear genetic bases. For instance, because of a high frequency of a specific gene variant \textbf{African} Americans have more sensitive androgen receptors than other Americans and this is part, though not all, of why they have high rates of prostate cancer. To give a second example, there was recently a study that found that two gene variants known to put people at risk for diabetes are more \textbf{common} among the Mexican population than among the American population.¬†The discussion of clines is also problematic. A Cline refers to a situation in which a trait changes very gradually and as a function of geographical distance. Skin color, which changes very gradually as populations move away from the equator, is a \textbf{common} example of this. But not all human genetic variation is clinal. There are sharp discontinuities in how gene frequencies changes across populations. This is why if you compare three populations that are all equally distance from each-other in terms of geography the two that are within the same \textbf{race} will be more similar genetically.¬†Racial categories are artifacts of culture in the sense that they are categories that humans invent. But they are categories that group people based on real biological differences and are no less valid than any other category used in biology, all of which were invented by humans.\normalsize   & \cellcolor{green!5}African, Common, Nothing, Race & \cellcolor{green!5}Age - Youngsters, Ethnicity - Black, Ethnicity - General, Social Class - Working class & \cellcolor{green!5}9/383 & \cellcolor{green!5}2.35 \\  \hline

  \cellcolor{green!27}\small You make a good argument, but I think you are using specific examples to muddy the general point, a bit; this video was essentially trying to assert how humans, despite racial differences, are very much the same species and even  genus, with the biological variance being minimal at best. This goes to other ways of defining a species, including similarity of DNA, morphology, or ecological niche.  Please note, "\textbf{Race}" specifically doesn't come into this. But, to be fair again, the presence of regionally adaptive traits which accont for racial diversity in humanity may be seen in a way which further subdivide species into infraspecific taxa such as subspecies. But again, there is no solid argument for saying one \textbf{race}/ethnicity is a "subspecies" of another; you can track all modern-day human DNA back to  Africa, despite the percentage of variation.   \cellcolor{green!5}\small \@Shenruss Mornin'. No I'm not stating hybrid vigor doesn't exist, because it does. Too bad it doesn't have anything to do with this argument as it applies to a whole different level of genetic difference.Hybrid vigor is only a positive thing if the alternative is incest, in which case the genetic similarities would be too severe in terms of alleles, not just genes. You won't even face that problem in the first place if you breed with someone who isn't closely blood-related to you even though they're of the same \textbf{race}, as that already counts as hybrid vigor. In that case there is enough allele variation to prevent side effects of incest.Mating with someone of a different \textbf{race} however introduces quite a few problems, a phenomenon called outbreeding depression (if whoever told you about hybrid vigor didn't tell you about outbreeding depression in respect to humans they were purposely misleading you. Just letting you know).All population groups such as races have some distinct groups of genes or sets of alleles that reoccur within that group, sort of like a genetic fingerprint. If two individuals of the same population group mate, the offspring will inherit the same group of genes and alleles, with a bit of variation (this is hybrid vigor). These gene-groups often deal with metabolism or some form of adaptation to the environment where that population group lived for generations. What's important about this is that they're only effective together in that distinct group (this is called genetic integrity).If two people of different races mate, their offspring won't inherit either one of the genetic finger prints of either parent, but rather parts of one and parts of the other group. This group of genes lacks genetic integrity and thus loses its functionality (statistically most of the time. There are exceptions in which the resulting genetic group had some advantageous functionality, but those are rare cases). This is why during evolution, mixed individuals of different races of any species have been less successful in terms of survival than non-mixed individuals.\normalsize   & \cellcolor{green!5}Race & \cellcolor{green!5}Ethnicity - General & \cellcolor{green!5}2/344 & \cellcolor{green!5}0.581 \\  \hline

Let's also assume that every gene that is homozygously recessive in one parent, it's homozygously dominant in the other. Once they cross, their offspring will be heterozygous in all their genes (hence the term heterosis), because for every gene he received one recessive and one dominant allele. But because in heterozygotes only the dominant allele has an effect while the recessive allele is repressed, the offspring will express the dominant version of all his genes. Assuming that the dominant version is typically associated with being the more advantageous (not always the case, just more \textbf{common}), the offspring will outperform either parent.   \cellcolor{green!5}\small I think its important to keep in mind that cognitively the human mind uses heuristics (\textbf{mental} shortcuts) to make decision In fact there is an IAT (Implicit Association Test) which shows how \textbf{racist} we actually are without knowing it (although there is some debate as to the validity of this test).  Every time we behave in a certain way we learn (operant conditioning) through reward and punishment we act a different way. If someone of the opposite \textbf{sex} are perceived as more attractive, we are more willing to help. This in itself is a form of \textbf{racism}. In fact attitudes like the damsel in distress or pretty being good (i.e. disney) are good examples.I think its important to know that our attention can't process all the information it receives simultaneously so we have to use heuristics. This in itself is a form of guessing what might happen. This action in itself called selective attention requires us to not use all of our mind to make decisions. According to Dual process theory, when we use system 1 we make implicit decisions using heuristics. Now as wrong ethically as those decisions may be, if we see one cultural group (\textbf{race}) typically complete one action such as stealing we may implicitly (non consciously) assume that that type of person are the type which commonly behave in that manner (stereotype). For that reason we may using our heuristics assume that one type of \textbf{race} or cultural group typically behave in such a negative manner (discrimination).For these reasons (there may be others) I believe that \textbf{racism} has biological routes from cognetive brain functions (selective attention  System 1  Heuristics) as well as social constructs (ie. a baby boy being given blue clothes and a baby girl being given pink clothes).\normalsize   & \cellcolor{green!5}Mental, Race, Racism, Racist, Sex & \cellcolor{green!5}Ethnicity - General, Gender - General, Physical Identity - Physical (and Mental) Impairments & \cellcolor{green!5}7/298 & \cellcolor{green!5}2.349 \\  \hline
